basics.name: Lea Effertz
basics.label: Student in Applied Geoinformatics
basics.summary: A German-born theoretical physicist, widely ranked among the greatest and most influential scientists of all time

education.summary: A research-led, English-taught Master's programme focused on spatial data acquisition and management, geospatial analysis, spatial simulation, and geovisualisation.
courses: Master Thesis: Spatial patterns of socially sustainable mobility: expanding a set of indicators to further include social aspects

education.summary: An interdisciplinary Bachelor's programme blending informatics, communications, and geoinformatics, focused on digital innovation, human-machine interaction, and designing information products.
courses: Bachelor Thesis: Sustainable student mobility â€“ Effects of mobility infrastructure on mode choice in a university context

work.name: Trafficon
work.summary: After completing my internship at Trafficon, a company specializing in providing mobility solutions, I started working there. I work in software engineereing, focusing on backend-development and in project development.

work.name: Mobility Lab, Salzburg University
work.summary: Working in the mobility lab, I mainly aided in research and worked in several projects. I worked in the projects  LMI-Sustain, SAFARI and helped developing the open-source toolbox NetAScore. I also helped in the development of the documentation for NetAScore.
